title: Family's 'holiday from hell' at TUI hotel with 'blood-stained sheets and bedbugs'
text:

A father-of-six has blasted TUI after claiming his hotel on a £4,400 Greek holiday had blood-stained sheets and bedbugs.

Andrew Wylde, his wife Danielle and their children booked their holiday at family resort the Atlantica Holiday Village Kos - but say they were left stunned after a series of apparent blunders from the outset.

They were also left fuming after being moved to another hotel that they say was unsuitable for children and lacked disability access.

Despite having six kids aged between three and 12, one of whom is wheelchair-bound.

After they say their complaints to TUI fell on deaf ears, the couple have contacted consumer claims legal firm, Bott and Co, to help them claim compensation, reports the Liverpool Echo.

(Image: Liverpool Echo)

A TUI spokesperson said it was "very sorry" to hear of the family's experience but that it was not appropriate to comment further as it was now a legal matter.

Andrew said: “We spent a year saving up the money for the holiday and had full faith in TUI. They let us down massively, especially the kids.”

Full time carers Andrew, 40, and Danielle, 29, took every step to ensure the holiday was suitable - particularly as their five-year-old daughter Alanna-Rose suffers from cerebral palsy.

Andrew said: “TUI recommended the Atlantica Holiday Village Kos, in Greece as the perfect place for a family holiday.

"Despite reading some negative reviews online about the hygiene and cleanliness that sent alarm bells ringing, we were reassured by TUI that there were no issues to be concerned about.

"Within the first day of being there, our worst nightmares were confirmed.”

He continued: “We noticed straight away that there were ants crawling around both rooms, pubic hair in the bathrooms and blood stains on the bedsheets. It just wasn’t up to standards at all.

(Image: Liverpool Echo)

"We were told that the TUI rep wouldn’t be available until 9am and that we’d have to wait to speak to someone."

They say ventually the hotel management offered to upgrade their room, but not for three days, and later that night the family claim they discovered bedbugs crawling all over the mattress and pillows.

“The children were very unsettled and my wife stayed up all night in an arm chair," he added. "We came on holiday to enjoy ourselves. Caring for our six kids, including one with a disability is hard, and going on holiday is a chance to relax which we were unable to do."

The following morning they were moved to a nearby 5-star hotel, the Atlantica Porto Bello Royal, but it did not have disability access or child-friendly facilities.

The family was also put in two rooms not on the ground floor, so Andrew had to lift his disabled daughter down two flights of stairs each day - but the worst surprise was they claim they had managed to bring bedbugs with them from the previous hotel.

Andrew continued: "They had got into our suitcases so we had to throw ours away that were expensive and TUI replaced them with cheap ones that weren’t anything like our original matching cases.

"Our clothes were riddled with the bugs so had to be sent off for cleaning leaving us without a change of clothes for nearly two days. When we got our clothes back, a lot of the items had shrunk.”

(Image: Liverpool Echo)

The family continued to alert the TUI reps and they were offered a £250 holiday voucher, which Andrew said was unacceptable given the getaway cost £4,428.

He contacted them again but claimed they said they could not find any issues and were not prepared to compensate them.

“We have video evidence and a letter from the hotel manager apologising about the problems we were faced with, yet TUI still deny it all," Andrew added.

While still in Greece, Andrew came across positive mentions of Bott and Co Solicitors on a Facebook TUI complaints page and contacted the firm asking for advice.

“When I spoke to Bott and Co, they told me to write everything down, take photos and video evidence and continue making complaints to the on-site TUI reps.

"They offered to take our case on and so when TUI continued to not take responsibility and refused to pay compensation I immediately got back in touch with them to make a claim.”
description:
Andrew Wylde and his wife Danielle, from  Wallasey
near Liverpool, have sought help from a legal firm to get compensation for the disastrous holiday
